item.title: Ubisoft Delays Earnings Report, Halts Share Trading Minutes Before Release
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft is no longer delaying its games. Now it’s delaying earnings reports.

Just minutes before it was scheduled to release it was scheduled to announce its first half earnings for fiscal year 2025-26 (FY26), the company announced that it was postponing its call.

In addition to the postponement of the results, Ubisoft announced that it had requested Euronext to halt trading of company shares.

“Ubisoft has requested Euronext to halt trading of its shares and its bonds from the market opening on November 14, 2025, until the publication of its first-half 2025-26 results in the coming days,” the company said in a statement.

“Ubisoft will inform the market of the date on which trading will restart.”

Insider Gaming has reached out to Ubisoft for more clarification on the delay and trade halting. Should a response be received, it will be added to this story.

What do you make of Ubisoft delaying its earnings report and requesting the halting of share trading? Leave your thoughts down in the comments and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, check out details on the brand-new Steam Machine from Valve. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

Red Dead Redemption Coming To Netflix

Red Dead Redemption will be playable on Android and iOS devices through Netflix next month. Here are more details.

Embark Studios Just Nerfed ARC Raiders’ Most OP Perk

Embark Studios has nerfed Security Breach, the best perk in ARC Raiders. Check out why and what it means for the game here.

Pokémon Pokopia Trailer Reveals New Pikachu & Snorlax Variants

The latest trailer for Pokémon Pokopia showed off strange variants of Pikachu and Snorlax, alongside revealing gameplay details.

The Indie Game Awards 2025 Nominees Announced

The Indie Game Awards have announced the full list of nominees, presenters, and judges for 2025. Insider Gaming has the full list of nominees.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1609: Hints And Answer For November 14, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1609 for November 14, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, November 14, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1609 should be an easier puzzle for most players. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4 of 6 guesses. That makes it nearly a full guess easier than the 4.8 guess average from November 13.

General Wordle Hints For November 14

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The word contains two vowels
  • Hint 2: It includes four different consonants.
  • Hint 3: Only one letter in the word appears in the first half of the alphabet.
  • Hint 4: The word contains no S, T, or N, which are common in many answers.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1609 for November 14, 2025

Starter Words For November 14, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • FLUID
  • BUILD
  • LURED

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1609 On November 14, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: LURID

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

Lurid is an adjective that actually has a number of definitions. It can mean something gruesome or revolting, vivid or sensational, terrible in intensity, and even lighted or shining in an “unnatural glow”.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1608 on November 13, 2025:

Answer: TINGE

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1609?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on November 15 will be Wordle Game #1610.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you’d like tips and clues for in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption Coming To Netflix
item.content:encoded:
Red Dead Redemption is set to release for Android and iOS through Netflix on December 4, 2025.

The original Red Dead Redemption has already been in the news today, with an ESRB rating appearing for current-gen consoles, including the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and Nintendo Switch. Now, it seems that, along with these platforms, a mobile port will also be arriving for RDR.

Red Dead Redemption is Coming to Android and iOS Devices in December 2025

The iOS App Store and Google Play Store pages for Red Dead Redemption have already been made available online. The page clearly states that a Netflix membership will be required to play Red Dead Redemption on these devices. On iOS devices, the game will occupy approximately 3.1GB of storage space. To run the game, players must be running iOS 18.0 or later and iPadOS 18.0 or later. The title doesn’t include any multiplayer content.

Android and iOS device users will be able to get the complete Red Dead Redemption experience with this version, allowing them to not only experience the entire narrative where John Marston hunts a gang of criminals across the American West and Mexico, but also Undead Nightmare DLC content, where the game’s world is transformed into an “apocalyptic fight for survival against a zombie horde.”

In other news, Red Dead Redemption 2 has become the fourth best-selling game ever in terms of units sold. Additionally, more ‘enhanced version’ claims for RDR2 have surfaced online. What are your thoughts on Red Dead Redemption coming to Android and iOS devices via Netflix? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Embark Studios nerfing ARC Raiders’ most overpowered perk. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Embark Studios Just Nerfed ARC Raiders’ Most OP Perk
item.content:encoded:
Embark Studios rolled out the 1.2.0 update for ARC Raiders today, introducing a new community-wide event, the dawn of a new map, and new ARC enemies to contend with. The team also issued several quality-of-life improvements, tweaks, and bug fixes. They also pushed out a silent adjustment to the Security Breach perk, nerfing the heck out of it.

In a move that some fans have questioned, the most OP perk in ARC Raiders has been dialled back. If you were pushing for Security Breach, you might want to now focus your attention elsewhere, as the perk isn’t as good as it was over the last two weeks.

Security Breach Nerf Explained

In a post on the ARC Raiders Discord server, the game’s community lead, Ossen, wrote:

We adjusted the security lockers because they were over-providing valuable items

The comment earned a string of emoji-based responses, the most popular of which was the clown emoji… Make of that what you will.

For most, this is a good move from Embark Studios, as it helps to tone down the overpowered perk that ‘chads’ were abusing to stack their stashes to the rafters with good equipment. It was also diluting the game’s experience, as the meta was to do night runs on maps like Buried City, soaking up loot routes and cracking open endless security lockers.

This change came in addition to some more positive ones, like the fact that desync has now been addressed, and you shouldn’t feel like you’ve been hit even though you dove behind cover. It also means that fighting ARC enemies will feel more accurate and reliable, not strangely disconnected and laggy.

The 1.2.0 update in ARC Raiders is live now on all platforms, and if you want to get access to the new map, you’ll need to work as a collective and provide enough resources to fuel the project.

Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you’re enjoying ARC Raiders.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Red Dead has received an ESRB rating for modern consoles

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.
